The nine teams of the East Division competed in a 40-game schedule, while the eight teams of the West Division played a 42-game schedule. The top 8 teams of each division make the playoffs. The winner of the OPJHL playoffs, the [[Orillia Terriers]], failed to win the 1996 Buckland Cup for the OHA championship.http://members.shaw.ca/vernonfranchise/league/cups/national_champions.html ==Changes== *League changes name from Central Junior A Hockey League to [[Ontario Provincial Junior A Hockey League]]. *League joins [[Canadian Junior A Hockey League]]. *[[Hamilton Kiltys]] join OPJHL from [[Golden Horseshoe Junior Hockey League|GHJHL]]. *[[Caledon Canadians]] leave OPJHL for [[MetJHL]]. *Mississauga Derbys move and become [[Streetsville Derbys]]. ==Final standings==
